segments.pli: 15. Navapurāṇavagga
segments.en: 15. The Old and the New

segments.pli: 151. Antevāsikasutta
segments.en: 151. A Student

segments.pli: “Anantevāsikamidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati anācariyakaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is lived without a resident student and without a teaching master.

segments.pli: Santevāsiko, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sācariyako dukkhaṃ na phāsu viharati.
segments.en: A mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.

segments.pli: Anantevāsiko, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anācariyako sukhaṃ phāsu viharati.
segments.en: A mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhu, santevāsiko sācariyako dukkhaṃ na phāsu viharati?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master live in suffering and discomfort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā sarasaṅkappā saṃyojaniyā.
segments.en: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unskillful phenomena arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.

segments.pli: Tyāssa anto vasanti, antassa vasanti pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unskillful qualities residing within,

segments.pli: Tasmā santevāsikoti vuccati.
segments.en: they’re said to have a resident student.

segments.pli: Te naṃ samudācaranti, samudācaranti naṃ pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unskillful qualities,

segments.pli: Tasmā sācariyakoti vuccati … pe ….
segments.en: they’re said to have a teaching master.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā sarasaṅkappā saṃyojaniyā.
segments.en: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: Tyāssa anto vasanti, antassa vasanti pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
Tasmā santevāsikoti vuccati.
Te naṃ samudācaranti, samudācaranti naṃ pāpakā akusalā dhammāti. Tasmā sācariyakoti vuccati … pe ….
Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno manasā dhammaṃ viññāya uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā sarasaṅkappā saṃyojaniyā.
segments.en: knows a thought with the mind, bad, unskillful phenomena arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.

segments.pli: Tyāssa anto vasanti, antassa vasanti pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unskillful qualities residing within,

segments.pli: Tasmā santevāsikoti vuccati.
segments.en: they’re said to have a resident student.

segments.pli: Te naṃ samudācaranti, samudācaranti naṃ pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unskillful qualities,

segments.pli: Tasmā sācariyakoti vuccati.
segments.en: they’re said to have a teaching master.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu santevāsiko sācariyako dukkhaṃ, na phāsu viharati.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anantevāsiko anācariyako sukhaṃ phāsu viharati?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master live in happiness and comfort?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā sarasaṅkappā saṃyojaniyā.
segments.en: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unskillful phenomena don’t arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.

segments.pli: Tyāssa na anto vasanti, nāssa anto vasanti pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities don’t reside within. Since they don’t have bad unskillful qualities residing within,

segments.pli: Tasmā anantevāsikoti vuccati.
segments.en: they’re said to not have a resident student.

segments.pli: Te naṃ na samudācaranti, na samudācaranti naṃ pāpakā akusalā dhammāti.
segments.en: Those qualities don’t master them. Since they’re not mastered by bad unskillful qualities,

segments.pli: Tasmā anācariyakoti vuccati … pe ….
segments.en: they’re said to not have a teaching master.

segments.en: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …

Tasmā anantevāsikoti vuccati.
Te naṃ na samudācaranti, na samudācaranti naṃ pāpakā akusalā dhammāti. Tasmā anācariyakoti vuccati … pe ….

segments.en: That’s how a mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.

segments.pli: Anantevāsikamidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati.
segments.en: This spiritual life is lived without a resident student and without a teaching master.

segments.pli: Anācariyakaṃ santevāsiko, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sācariyako dukkhaṃ, na phāsu viharati.
segments.en: A mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.

sections.title: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is lived without a resident…

suttaplex.blurb: One with no “student” and no “teacher” dwells in suffering. Here the Buddha plays with the Pali words such that “student” means “one who dwells within” and “teacher” means “one who assails”.
